00075 struct prefix_face_list_item {

00079     struct prefix_face_list_item *next;

00085 static struct ccn_charbuf *local_scope_template = NULL;
00086 static struct ccn_charbuf *no_name = NULL;
00087 static unsigned char ccndid_storage[32] = {0};
00088 static const unsigned char *ccndid = ccndid_storage;
00089 static size_t ccndid_size;

00096 
00097 static void
00098 usage(const char *progname)
00099 {
00100     fprintf(stderr,
00101             "%s [-d] [-v] (-f configfile | (add|del) uri (udp|tcp) host [port [flags [mcastttl [mcastif]]]])\n"
00102             "   -d enter dynamic mode and create FIB entries based on DNS SRV records\n"
00103             "   -f configfile add or delete FIB entries based on contents of configfile\n"
00104             "   -v increase logging level\n"
00105             "   add|del add or delete FIB entry based on parameters\n",
00106             progname);
00107     exit(1);
00108 }
00109 
00110 void
00111 ccndc_warn(int lineno, char *format, ...)
00112 {
00113     struct timeval t;
00114     va_list ap;
00115     va_start(ap, format);
00116     gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00117     fprintf(stderr, "%d.%06d ccndc[%d]:%d: ", (int)t.tv_sec, (unsigned)t.tv_usec, (int)getpid(), lineno);
00118     vfprintf(stderr, format, ap);
00119     va_end(ap);
00120 }
00121 
00122 void
00123 ccndc_fatal(int line, char *format, ...)
00124 {
00125     struct timeval t;
00126     va_list ap;
00127     va_start(ap, format);
00128     gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00129     fprintf(stderr, "%d.%06d ccndc[%d]:%d: ", (int)t.tv_sec, (unsigned)t.tv_usec, (int)getpid(), line);
00130     vfprintf(stderr, format, ap);
00131     va_end(ap);
00132     exit(1);
00133 }
00134 
00135 #define ON_ERROR_EXIT(resval) on_error_exit((resval), __LINE__)
00136 
00137 static void
00138 on_error_exit(int res, int lineno)
00139 {
00140     if (res >= 0)
00141         return;
00142     ccndc_fatal(lineno, "fatal error, res = %d\n", res);
00143 }
00144 
00145 #define ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(resval) \
00146 {                       \
00147 if ((resval) < 0) { \
00148 if (verbose > 0) ccndc_warn (__LINE__, "OnError cleanup\n"); \
00149 goto Cleanup; \
00150 } \
00151 }
00152 
00153 #define ON_NULL_CLEANUP(resval) \
00154 {                       \
00155 if ((resval) == NULL) { \
00156 if (verbose > 0) ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "OnNull cleanup\n"); \
00157 goto Cleanup; \
00158 } \
00159 }
00160 
00161 static void
00162 initialize_global_data(void) {
00163     /* Set up an Interest template to indicate scope 1 (Local) */
00164     local_scope_template = ccn_charbuf_create();
00165     if (local_scope_template == NULL) {
00166         ON_ERROR_EXIT(-1);
00167     }
00168     
00169     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_charbuf_append_tt(local_scope_template, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG));
00170     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_charbuf_append_tt(local_scope_template, CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG));
00171     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_charbuf_append_closer(local_scope_template));     /* </Name> */
00172     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccnb_tagged_putf(local_scope_template, CCN_DTAG_Scope, "1"));
00173     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_charbuf_append_closer(local_scope_template));     /* </Interest> */
00174     
00175     /* Create a null name */
00176     no_name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00177     if (no_name == NULL) {
00178         ON_ERROR_EXIT(-1);
00179     }
00180     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_name_init(no_name));
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*
00184  * this should eventually be used as the basis for a library function
00185  *    ccn_get_ccndid(...)
00186  * which would retrieve a copy of the ccndid from the
00187  * handle, where it should be cached.
00188  */
00189 static int
00190 get_ccndid(struct ccn *h, const unsigned char *ccndid, size_t ccndid_storage_size)
00191 {
00192     
00193     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
00194     struct ccn_charbuf *resultbuf = NULL;
00195     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcobuf = {0};
00196     char ping_uri[] = "ccnx:/ccnx/ping";
00197     const unsigned char *ccndid_result;
00198     static size_t ccndid_result_size;
00199     int res;
00200     
00201     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00202     if (name == NULL) {
00203         ON_ERROR_EXIT(-1);
00204     }
00205     
00206     resultbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00207     if (resultbuf == NULL) {
00208         ON_ERROR_EXIT(-1);
00209     }
00210     
00211     
00212     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_name_from_uri(name, ping_uri));
00213     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_name_append_nonce(name));
00214     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_get(h, name, local_scope_template, 4500, resultbuf, &pcobuf, NULL, 0));
00215     res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_PublisherPublicKeyDigest,
00216                               resultbuf->buf,
00217                               pcobuf.offset[CCN_PCO_B_PublisherPublicKeyDigest],
00218                               pcobuf.offset[CCN_PCO_E_PublisherPublicKeyDigest],
00219                               &ccndid_result, &ccndid_result_size);
00220     ON_ERROR_EXIT(res);
00221     if (ccndid_result_size > ccndid_storage_size)
00222         ON_ERROR_EXIT(-1);
00223     memcpy((void *)ccndid, ccndid_result, ccndid_result_size);
00224     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00225     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&resultbuf);
00226     return (ccndid_result_size);
00227 }
00228 
00229 static struct prefix_face_list_item *prefix_face_list_item_create(struct ccn_charbuf *prefix,
00230                                                                   int ipproto,
00231                                                                   int mcast_ttl,
00232                                                                   char *host,
00233                                                                   char *port,
00234                                                                   char *mcastif,
00235                                                                   int lifetime,
00236                                                                   int flags)
00237 {
00238     struct prefix_face_list_item *pfl = calloc(1, sizeof(struct prefix_face_list_item));
00239     struct ccn_face_instance *fi = calloc(1, sizeof(*fi));
00240     struct ccn_charbuf *store = ccn_charbuf_create();
00241     int host_off = -1;
00242     int port_off = -1;
00243     int mcast_off = -1;
00244     
00245     if (pfl == NULL || fi == NULL || store == NULL) {
00246         if (pfl) free(pfl);
00247         if (fi) ccn_face_instance_destroy(&fi);
00248         if (store) ccn_charbuf_destroy(&store);
00249         return (NULL);
00250     }
00251     pfl->fi = fi;
00252     pfl->fi->store = store;
00253     
00254     pfl->prefix = prefix;
00255     pfl->fi->descr.ipproto = ipproto;
00256     pfl->fi->descr.mcast_ttl = mcast_ttl;
00257     pfl->fi->lifetime = lifetime;
00258     pfl->flags = flags;
00259     
00260     ccn_charbuf_append(store, "newface", strlen("newface") + 1);
00261     host_off = store->length;
00262     ccn_charbuf_append(store, host, strlen(host) + 1);
00263     port_off = store->length;
00264     ccn_charbuf_append(store, port, strlen(port) + 1);
00265     if (mcastif != NULL) {
00266         mcast_off = store->length;
00267         ccn_charbuf_append(store, mcastif, strlen(mcastif) + 1);
00268     }
00269     // appending to a charbuf may move it, so we must wait until we have
00270     // finished appending before calculating the pointers into the store.
00271     char *b = (char *)store->buf;
00272     pfl->fi->action = b;
00273     pfl->fi->descr.address = b + host_off;
00274     pfl->fi->descr.port = b + port_off;
00275     pfl->fi->descr.source_address = (mcast_off == -1) ? NULL : b + mcast_off;
00276     
00277     return (pfl);
00278 }
00279 
00280 static void prefix_face_list_destroy(struct prefix_face_list_item **pflpp)
00281 {
00282     struct prefix_face_list_item *pflp = *pflpp;
00283     struct prefix_face_list_item *next;
00284     
00285     if (pflp == NULL) return;
00286     while (pflp) {
00287         ccn_face_instance_destroy(&pflp->fi);
00288         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pflp->prefix);
00289         next = pflp->next;
00290         free(pflp);
00291         pflp = next;
00292     }
00293     *pflpp = NULL;
00294 }
00295 
00296 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00297 signed_info_create(struct ccn_keystore *keystore)
00298 {
00299     struct ccn_charbuf *keylocator;
00300     struct ccn_charbuf *signed_info;
00301     int res;
00302     
00303     /* Construct a key locator containing the key itself */
00304     keylocator = ccn_charbuf_create();
00305     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_charbuf_append_tt(keylocator, CCN_DTAG_KeyLocator, CCN_DTAG));
00306     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_charbuf_append_tt(keylocator, CCN_DTAG_Key, CCN_DTAG));
00307     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_append_pubkey_blob(keylocator, ccn_keystore_public_key(keystore)));
00308     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_charbuf_append_closer(keylocator));    /* </Key> */
00309     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_charbuf_append_closer(keylocator));    /* </KeyLocator> */
00310     
00311     signed_info = ccn_charbuf_create();
00312     res = ccn_signed_info_create(signed_info,
00313                                  /* pubkeyid */ ccn_keystore_public_key_digest(keystore),
00314                                  /* publisher_key_id_size */ ccn_keystore_public_key_digest_length(keystore),
00315                                  /* datetime */ NULL,
00316                                  /* type */ CCN_CONTENT_DATA,
00317                                  /* freshness */ -1L,
00318                                  /* finalblockid */ NULL,
00319                                  keylocator);
00320     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(res);
00321     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&keylocator);
00322     return (signed_info);
00323     
00324 Cleanup:
00325     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&keylocator);
00326     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&signed_info);
00327     return (NULL);
00328 }
00329 /**
00330  *  @brief Create a face based on the face attributes
00331  *  @param h  the ccnd handle
00332  *  @param keystore  a ccn keystore containing the keys used to authenticate this operation
00333  *  @param face_instance  the parameters of the face to be created
00334  *  @param flags
00335  *  @result returns new face_instance representing the face created
00336  */
00337 static struct ccn_face_instance *
00338 create_face(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_keystore *keystore,
00339             struct ccn_face_instance *face_instance)
00340 {
00341     struct ccn_charbuf *newface = NULL;
00342     struct ccn_charbuf *signed_info = NULL;
00343     struct ccn_charbuf *temp = NULL;
00344     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
00345     struct ccn_charbuf *resultbuf = NULL;
00346     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcobuf = {0};
00347     struct ccn_face_instance *new_face_instance = NULL;
00348     const unsigned char *ptr = NULL;
00349     size_t length = 0;
00350     int res = 0;
00351     
00352     /* Encode the given face instance */
00353     newface = ccn_charbuf_create();
00354     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(newface);
00355     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccnb_append_face_instance(newface, face_instance));
00356     
00357     signed_info = signed_info_create(keystore);
00358     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(signed_info);
00359     
00360     temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00361     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(temp);
00362     
00363     res = ccn_encode_ContentObject(temp,
00364                                    no_name,
00365                                    signed_info,
00366                                    newface->buf,
00367                                    newface->length,
00368                                    NULL,
00369                                    ccn_keystore_private_key(keystore));
00370     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(res);
00371     
00372     resultbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00373     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(resultbuf);
00374     
00375     /* Construct the Interest name that will create the face */
00376     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00377     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(name);
00378     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_init(name));
00379     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append_str(name, "ccnx"));
00380     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append(name, face_instance->ccnd_id, face_instance->ccnd_id_size));
00381     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append_str(name, face_instance->action));
00382     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append(name, temp->buf, temp->length));
00383     res = ccn_get(h, name, local_scope_template, 1000, resultbuf, &pcobuf, NULL, 0);
00384     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(res);
00385     
00386     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_content_get_value(resultbuf->buf, resultbuf->length, &pcobuf, &ptr, &length));
00387     new_face_instance = ccn_face_instance_parse(ptr, length);
00388     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(new_face_instance);
00389     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&newface);
00390     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&signed_info);
00391     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00392     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&resultbuf);
00393     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00394     return (new_face_instance);
00395     
00396 Cleanup:
00397     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&newface);
00398     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&signed_info);
00399     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00400     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&resultbuf);
00401     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00402     ccn_face_instance_destroy(&new_face_instance);
00403     return (NULL);
00404 }
00405 /**
00406  *  @brief Register an interest prefix as being routed to a given face
00407  *  @param h  the ccnd handle
00408  *  @param keystore  a ccn keystore containing the keys used to authenticate this operation
00409  *  @param name_prefix  the prefix to be registered
00410  *  @param face_instance  the face to which the interests with the prefix should be routed
00411  *  @param flags
00412  *  @result returns (positive) faceid on success, -1 on error
00413  */
00414 static int
00415 register_unregister_prefix(struct ccn *h,
00416                            struct ccn_keystore *keystore,
00417                            int operation,
00418                            struct ccn_charbuf *name_prefix,
00419                            struct ccn_face_instance *face_instance,
00420                            int flags)
00421 {
00422     struct ccn_charbuf *temp = NULL;
00423     struct ccn_charbuf *resultbuf = NULL;
00424     struct ccn_charbuf *signed_info = NULL;
00425     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
00426     struct ccn_charbuf *prefixreg = NULL;
00427     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcobuf = {0};
00428     struct ccn_forwarding_entry forwarding_entry_storage = {0};
00429     struct ccn_forwarding_entry *forwarding_entry = &forwarding_entry_storage;
00430     struct ccn_forwarding_entry *new_forwarding_entry;
00431     const unsigned char *ptr = NULL;
00432     size_t length = 0;
00433     int res;
00434     
00435     /* Register or unregister the prefix */
00436     forwarding_entry->action = (operation == OP_REG) ? "prefixreg" : "unreg";
00437     forwarding_entry->name_prefix = name_prefix;
00438     forwarding_entry->ccnd_id = face_instance->ccnd_id;
00439     forwarding_entry->ccnd_id_size = face_instance->ccnd_id_size;
00440     forwarding_entry->faceid = face_instance->faceid;
00441     forwarding_entry->flags = flags;
00442     forwarding_entry->lifetime = (~0U) >> 1;
00443     
00444     prefixreg = ccn_charbuf_create();
00445     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(prefixreg);
00446     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccnb_append_forwarding_entry(prefixreg, forwarding_entry));
00447     temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00448     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(temp);
00449     signed_info = signed_info_create(keystore);
00450     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(signed_info);
00451     res = ccn_encode_ContentObject(temp,
00452                                    no_name,
00453                                    signed_info,
00454                                    prefixreg->buf,
00455                                    prefixreg->length,
00456                                    NULL,
00457                                    ccn_keystore_private_key(keystore));
00458     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(res);
00459     resultbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00460     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(resultbuf);
00461     name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00462     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_init(name));
00463     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append_str(name, "ccnx"));
00464     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append(name, face_instance->ccnd_id, face_instance->ccnd_id_size));
00465     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append_str(name, (operation == OP_REG) ? "prefixreg" : "unreg"));
00466     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_name_append(name, temp->buf, temp->length));
00467     res = ccn_get(h, name, local_scope_template, 1000, resultbuf, &pcobuf, NULL, 0);
00468     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(res);
00469     ON_ERROR_CLEANUP(ccn_content_get_value(resultbuf->buf, resultbuf->length, &pcobuf, &ptr, &length));
00470     new_forwarding_entry = ccn_forwarding_entry_parse(ptr, length);
00471     ON_NULL_CLEANUP(new_forwarding_entry);
00472     
00473     res = new_forwarding_entry->faceid;
00474 
00475     ccn_forwarding_entry_destroy(&new_forwarding_entry);
00476     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&signed_info);
00477     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00478     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&resultbuf);
00479     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00480     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefixreg);
00481     
00482     return (res);
00483     
00484     /* This is where ON_ERROR_CLEANUP sends us in case of an error
00485      * and we must free any storage we allocated before returning.
00486      */
00487 Cleanup:
00488     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&signed_info);
00489     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00490     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&resultbuf);
00491     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00492     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefixreg);
00493     
00494     return (-1);
00495 }
00496 
00497 static int
00498 process_command_tokens(struct prefix_face_list_item *pfltail,
00499                        int lineno,
00500                        char *cmd,
00501                        char *uri,
00502                        char *proto,
00503                        char *host,
00504                        char *port,
00505                        char *flags,
00506                        char *mcastttl,
00507                        char *mcastif)
00508 {
00509     int lifetime;
00510     struct ccn_charbuf *prefix;
00511     int ipproto;
00512     int socktype;
00513     int iflags;
00514     int imcastttl;
00515     char rhostnamebuf[NI_MAXHOST];
00516     char rhostportbuf[NI_MAXSERV];
00517     struct addrinfo hints = {.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC, .ai_flags = (AI_ADDRCONFIG)};
00518     struct addrinfo mcasthints = {.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC, .ai_flags = (AI_ADDRCONFIG | AI_NUMERICHOST)};
00519     struct addrinfo *raddrinfo = NULL;
00520     struct addrinfo *mcastifaddrinfo = NULL;
00521     struct prefix_face_list_item *pflp;
00522     int res;
00523     
00524     if (cmd == NULL) {
00525         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), missing command\n", lineno);
00526         return (-1);
00527     }   
00528     if (strcasecmp(cmd, "add") == 0)
00529         lifetime = (~0U) >> 1;
00530     else if (strcasecmp(cmd, "del") == 0)
00531         lifetime = 0;
00532     else {
00533         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), unrecognized command '%s'\n", lineno, cmd);
00534         return (-1);
00535     }
00536     
00537     if (uri == NULL) {
00538         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), missing CCNx URI\n", lineno);
00539         return (-1);
00540     }   
00541     prefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00542     res = ccn_name_from_uri(prefix, uri);
00543     if (res < 0) {
00544         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), bad CCNx URI '%s'\n", lineno, uri);
00545         return (-1);
00546     }
00547     
00548     if (proto == NULL) {
00549         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), missing address type\n", lineno);
00550         return (-1);
00551     }
00552     if (strcasecmp(proto, "udp") == 0) {
00553         ipproto = IPPROTO_UDP;
00554         socktype = SOCK_DGRAM;
00555     }
00556     else if (strcasecmp(proto, "tcp") == 0) {
00557         ipproto = IPPROTO_TCP;
00558         socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00559     }
00560     else {
00561         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), unrecognized address type '%s'\n", lineno, proto);
00562         return (-1);
00563     }
00564     
00565     if (host == NULL) {
00566         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), missing hostname\n", lineno);
00567         return (-1);
00568     }
00569     
00570     if (port == NULL || port[0] == 0)
00571         port = CCN_DEFAULT_UNICAST_PORT;
00572     
00573     hints.ai_socktype = socktype;
00574     res = getaddrinfo(host, port, &hints, &raddrinfo);
00575     if (res != 0 || raddrinfo == NULL) {
00576         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), getaddrinfo: %s\n", lineno, gai_strerror(res));
00577         return (-1);
00578     }
00579     res = getnameinfo(raddrinfo->ai_addr, raddrinfo->ai_addrlen,
00580                       rhostnamebuf, sizeof(rhostnamebuf),
00581                       rhostportbuf, sizeof(rhostportbuf),
00582                       NI_NUMERICHOST | NI_NUMERICSERV);
00583     freeaddrinfo(raddrinfo);
00584     if (res != 0) {
00585         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), getnameinfo: %s\n", lineno, gai_strerror(res));
00586         return (-1);
00587     }
00588     
00589     iflags = -1;
00590     if (flags != NULL && flags[0] != 0) {
00591         iflags = atoi(flags);
00592         if ((iflags & ~CCN_FORW_PUBMASK) != 0) {
00593             ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), invalid flags 0x%x\n", lineno, iflags);
00594             return (-1);
00595         }
00596     }
00597     
00598     imcastttl = -1;
00599     if (mcastttl != NULL) {
00600         imcastttl = atoi(mcastttl);
00601         if (imcastttl < 0 || imcastttl > 255) {
00602             ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), invalid multicast ttl: %s\n", lineno, mcastttl);
00603             return (-1);
00604         }
00605     }
00606     
00607     if (mcastif != NULL) {
00608         res = getaddrinfo(mcastif, NULL, &mcasthints, &mcastifaddrinfo);
00609         if (res != 0) {
00610             ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "command error (line %d), mcastifaddr getaddrinfo: %s\n", lineno, gai_strerror(res));
00611             return (-1);
00612         }
00613     }
00614     
00615     /* we have successfully parsed a command line */
00616     pflp = prefix_face_list_item_create(prefix, ipproto, imcastttl, rhostnamebuf, rhostportbuf, mcastif, lifetime, iflags);
00617     if (pflp == NULL) {
00618         ccndc_fatal(__LINE__, "Unable to allocate prefix_face_list_item\n");
00619     }
00620     pfltail->next = pflp;
00621     return (0);
00622 }
00623 
00624 static int
00625 read_configfile(const char *filename, struct prefix_face_list_item *pfltail)
00626 {
00627     int configerrors = 0;
00628     int lineno = 0;
00629     char *cmd;
00630     char *uri;
00631     char *proto;
00632     char *host;
00633     char *port;
00634     char *flags;
00635     char *mcastttl;
00636     char *mcastif;
00637     FILE *cfg;
00638     char buf[1024];
00639     const char *seps = " \t\n";
00640     char *cp = NULL;
00641     char *last = NULL;
00642     int res;
00643     
00644     cfg = fopen(filename, "r");
00645     if (cfg == NULL)
00646         ccndc_fatal(__LINE__, "%s (%s)\n", strerror(errno), filename);
00647     
00648     while (fgets((char *)buf, sizeof(buf), cfg)) {
00649         int len;
00650         lineno++;
00651         len = strlen(buf);
00652         if (buf[0] == '#' || len == 0)
00653             continue;
00654         if (buf[len - 1] == '\n')
00655             buf[len - 1] = '\0';
00656         cp = index(buf, '#');
00657         if (cp != NULL)
00658             *cp = '\0';
00659         
00660         cmd = strtok_r(buf, seps, &last);
00661         if (cmd == NULL)        /* blank line */
00662             continue;
00663         uri = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00664         proto = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00665         host = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00666         port = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00667         flags = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00668         mcastttl = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00669         mcastif = strtok_r(NULL, seps, &last);
00670         res = process_command_tokens(pfltail, lineno, cmd, uri, proto, host, port, flags, mcastttl, mcastif);
00671         if (res < 0) {
00672             configerrors--;
00673         } else {
00674             pfltail = pfltail->next;
00675         }
00676     }
00677     fclose(cfg);
00678     return (configerrors);
00679 }
00680 int query_srv(const unsigned char *domain, int domain_size,
00681               char **hostp, int *portp, char **proto)
00682 {
00683     union {
00684         HEADER header;
00685         unsigned char buf[NS_MAXMSG];
00686     } ans;
00687     ssize_t ans_size;
00688     char srv_name[NS_MAXDNAME];
00689     int qdcount, ancount, i;
00690     unsigned char *msg, *msgend;
00691     unsigned char *end;
00692     int type = 0, class = 0, ttl = 0, size = 0, priority = 0, weight = 0, port = 0, minpriority;
00693     char host[NS_MAXDNAME];
00694     
00695     res_init();
00696     
00697     /* Step 1: construct the SRV record name, and see if there's a ccn service gateway.
00698      *         Prefer TCP service over UDP, though this might change.
00699      */
00700     
00701     *proto = "tcp";
00702     snprintf(srv_name, sizeof(srv_name), "_ccnx._tcp.%.*s", (int)domain_size, domain);
00703     ans_size = res_query(srv_name, C_IN, T_SRV, ans.buf, sizeof(ans.buf));
00704     if (ans_size < 0) {
00705         *proto = "udp";
00706         snprintf(srv_name, sizeof(srv_name), "_ccnx._udp.%.*s", (int)domain_size, domain);
00707         ans_size = res_query(srv_name, C_IN, T_SRV, ans.buf, sizeof(ans.buf));
00708         if (ans_size < 0)
00709             return (-1);
00710     }
00711     if (ans_size > sizeof(ans.buf))
00712         return (-1);
00713     
00714     /* Step 2: skip over the header and question sections */
00715     qdcount = ntohs(ans.header.qdcount);
00716     ancount = ntohs(ans.header.ancount);
00717     msg = ans.buf + sizeof(ans.header);
00718     msgend = ans.buf + ans_size;
00719     
00720     for (i = qdcount; i > 0; --i) {
00721         if ((size = dn_skipname(msg, msgend)) < 0)
00722             return (-1);
00723         msg = msg + size + QFIXEDSZ;
00724     }
00725     /* Step 3: process the answer section
00726      *  return only the most desirable entry.
00727      *  TODO: perhaps return a list of the decoded priority/weight/port/target
00728      */
00729     
00730     minpriority = INT_MAX;
00731     for (i = ancount; i > 0; --i) {
00732         size = dn_expand(ans.buf, msgend, msg, srv_name, sizeof (srv_name));
00733         if (size < 0) 
00734             return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00735         msg = msg + size;
00736         GETSHORT(type, msg);
00737         GETSHORT(class, msg);
00738         GETLONG(ttl, msg);
00739         GETSHORT(size, msg);
00740         if ((end = msg + size) > msgend)
00741             return (-1);
00742         
00743         if (type != T_SRV) {
00744             msg = end;
00745             continue;
00746         }
00747         
00748         /* if the priority is numerically lower (more desirable) then remember
00749          * everything -- note that priority is destroyed, but we don't use it
00750          * when we register a prefix so it doesn't matter -- only the host
00751          * and port are necessary.
00752          */
00753         GETSHORT(priority, msg);
00754         if (priority < minpriority) {
00755             minpriority = priority;
00756             GETSHORT(weight, msg);
00757             GETSHORT(port, msg);
00758             size = dn_expand(ans.buf, msgend, msg, host, sizeof (host));
00759             if (size < 0)
00760                 return (-1);
00761         }
00762         msg = end;
00763     }
00764     if (hostp) {
00765         size = strlen(host);
00766         *hostp = calloc(1, size);
00767         if (!*hostp)
00768             return (-1);
00769         strncpy(*hostp, host, size);
00770     }
00771     if (portp) {
00772         *portp = port;
00773     }
00774     return (0);
00775 }
00776 
00777 void
00778 process_prefix_face_list_item(struct ccn *h,
00779                               struct ccn_keystore *keystore,
00780                               struct prefix_face_list_item *pfl) 
00781 {
00782     struct ccn_face_instance *nfi;
00783     struct ccn_charbuf *temp;
00784     int op;
00785     int res;
00786     
00787     op = (pfl->fi->lifetime > 0) ? OP_REG : OP_UNREG;
00788     pfl->fi->ccnd_id = ccndid;
00789     pfl->fi->ccnd_id_size = ccndid_size;
00790     nfi = create_face(h, keystore, pfl->fi);
00791     if (nfi == NULL) {
00792         temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00793         ccn_uri_append(temp, pfl->prefix->buf, pfl->prefix->length, 1);
00794         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "Unable to create face for %s %s %s %s %s\n",
00795                    (op == OP_REG) ? "add" : "del", ccn_charbuf_as_string(temp),
00796                    (pfl->fi->descr.ipproto == IPPROTO_UDP) ? "udp" : "tcp",
00797                    pfl->fi->descr.address,
00798                    pfl->fi->descr.port);
00799         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00800         return;
00801     }
00802 
00803     res = register_unregister_prefix(h, keystore, op, pfl->prefix, nfi, pfl->flags);
00804     if (res < 0) {
00805         temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00806         ccn_uri_append(temp, pfl->prefix->buf, pfl->prefix->length, 1);
00807         ccndc_warn(__LINE__, "Unable to %sregister prefix on face %d for %s %s %s %s %s\n",
00808                    (op == OP_UNREG) ? "un" : "", nfi->faceid,
00809                    (op == OP_REG) ? "add" : "del",
00810                    ccn_charbuf_as_string(temp),
00811                    (pfl->fi->descr.ipproto == IPPROTO_UDP) ? "udp" : "tcp",
00812                    pfl->fi->descr.address,
00813                    pfl->fi->descr.port);
00814         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00815     }
00816 
00817     ccn_face_instance_destroy(&nfi);
00818     return;
00819 }
00820 
00821 enum ccn_upcall_res
00822 incoming_interest(
00823                   struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00824                   enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00825                   struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
00826 {
00827     const unsigned char *ccnb = info->interest_ccnb;
00828     struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = info->interest_comps;
00829     struct ccn_keystore *keystore = selfp->data;
00830     const unsigned char *comp0 = NULL;
00831     size_t comp0_size = 0;
00832     struct prefix_face_list_item pfl_storage = {0};
00833     struct prefix_face_list_item *pflhead = &pfl_storage;
00834     struct ccn_charbuf *uri;
00835     int port;
00836     char portstring[10];
00837     char *host;
00838     char *proto;
00839     int res;
00840     
00841     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL)
00842         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00843     if (kind != CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST)
00844         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00845     if (comps->n < 1)
00846         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00847     
00848     
00849     res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Component, ccnb, comps->buf[0], comps->buf[1],
00850                               &comp0, &comp0_size);
00851     if (res < 0 || comp0_size > (NS_MAXDNAME - 12))
00852         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00853     if (memchr(comp0, '.', comp0_size) == NULL)
00854         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00855     
00856     host = NULL;
00857     port = 0;
00858     res = query_srv(comp0, comp0_size, &host, &port, &proto);
00859     if (res < 0) {
00860         free(host);
00861         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00862     }
00863     
00864     uri = ccn_charbuf_create();
00865     ccn_charbuf_append_string(uri, "ccnx:/");
00866     ccn_uri_append_percentescaped(uri, comp0, comp0_size);
00867     snprintf(portstring, sizeof(portstring), "%d", port);
00868     
00869     /* now process the results */
00870     /* pflhead, lineno=0, "add" "ccnx:/asdfasdf.com/" "tcp|udp", host, portstring, NULL NULL NULL */
00871     res = process_command_tokens(pflhead, 0,
00872                                  "add",
00873                                  ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri),
00874                                  proto,
00875                                  host,
00876                                  portstring,
00877                                  NULL, NULL, NULL);
00878     if (res < 0)
00879         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00880 
00881     process_prefix_face_list_item(info->h, keystore, pflhead->next);
00882     prefix_face_list_destroy(&pflhead->next);
00883     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00884 }
00885 
00886 
00887 int
00888 main(int argc, char **argv)
00889 {
00890     struct ccn *h = NULL;
00891     struct ccn_charbuf *temp = NULL;
00892     const char *progname = NULL;
00893     const char *configfile = NULL;
00894     struct prefix_face_list_item pfl_storage = {0};
00895     struct prefix_face_list_item *pflhead = &pfl_storage;
00896     struct prefix_face_list_item *pfl;
00897     struct ccn_keystore *keystore = NULL;
00898     int dynamic = 0;
00899     struct ccn_closure interest_closure = {.p=&incoming_interest};
00900     int res;
00901     char ch;
00902     
00903     initialize_global_data();
00904     
00905     progname = argv[0];
00906     while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "hf:dv")) != -1) {
00907         switch (ch) {
00908             case 'f':
00909                 configfile = optarg;
00910                 break;
00911             case 'd':
00912                 dynamic = 1;
00913                 break;
00914             case 'v':
00915                 verbose++;
00916                 break;
00917             case 'h':
00918             default:
00919                 usage(progname);
00920         }
00921     }
00922     
00923     if (optind < argc) {
00924         /* config file cannot be combined with command line */
00925         if (configfile != NULL) {
00926             usage(progname);
00927         }
00928         /* (add|delete) uri type host [port [flags [mcast-ttl [mcast-if]]]] */
00929         
00930         if (argc - optind < 4 || argc - optind > 8)
00931             usage(progname);
00932         
00933         res = process_command_tokens(pflhead, 0,
00934                                      argv[optind],
00935                                      argv[optind+1],
00936                                      argv[optind+2],
00937                                      argv[optind+3],
00938                                      (optind + 4) < argc ? argv[optind+4] : NULL,
00939                                      (optind + 5) < argc ? argv[optind+5] : NULL,
00940                                      (optind + 6) < argc ? argv[optind+6] : NULL,
00941                                      (optind + 7) < argc ? argv[optind+7] : NULL);
00942         if (res < 0)
00943             usage(progname);
00944     }
00945     
00946     if (configfile) {
00947         read_configfile(configfile, pflhead);
00948     }
00949     
00950     h = ccn_create();
00951     res = ccn_connect(h, NULL);
00952     if (res < 0) {
00953         ccn_perror(h, "ccn_connect");
00954         exit(1);
00955     }
00956     
00957     
00958     
00959     temp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00960     keystore = ccn_keystore_create();
00961     ON_ERROR_EXIT(ccn_charbuf_putf(temp, "%s/.ccnx/.ccnx_keystore", getenv("HOME")));
00962     res = ccn_keystore_init(keystore,
00963                             ccn_charbuf_as_string(temp),
00964                             "Th1s1sn0t8g00dp8ssw0rd.");
00965     ON_ERROR_EXIT(res);
00966     
00967     ccndid_size = get_ccndid(h, ccndid, sizeof(ccndid_storage));
00968     for (pfl = pflhead->next; pfl != NULL; pfl = pfl->next) {
00969         process_prefix_face_list_item(h, keystore, pfl);
00970     }
00971     prefix_face_list_destroy(&pflhead->next);
00972     if (dynamic) {
00973         /* Set up a handler for interests */
00974         interest_closure.data = keystore;
00975         ccn_name_init(temp);
00976         ccn_set_interest_filter_with_flags(h, temp, &interest_closure,
00977                                            CCN_FORW_ACTIVE | CCN_FORW_CHILD_INHERIT | CCN_FORW_LAST);
00978         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00979         ccn_run(h, -1);
00980     }
00981     ccn_destroy(&h);
00982     exit(res < 0);
00983 }
